Sure, here are some examples of how Japan has modernized its navy's capabilities to address various threats:

1. Maritime surveillance: Japan has developed an advanced network of surveillance and reconnaissance systems that monitor and track maritime activities in its coastal waters and beyond. The navy has also acquired advanced unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and maritime patrol aircraft to enhance its surveillance capabilities.

2. Anti-submarine warfare: To counter the threat posed by North Korea's submarine fleet, Japan has developed advanced anti-submarine warfare capabilities. These include new sonar systems, aircraft, and submarines equipped with advanced sensors and weapons.

3. Amphibious assault capability: Following the Chinese takeover of the Senkaku/Diaoyu islands, Japan has developed an amphibious assault capability to defend its remote islands in the East China Sea. This includes the creation of a new amphibious force and the acquisition of amphibious assault vehicles and aircraft.

4. Ballistic missile defense: Japan has developed an advanced ballistic missile defense system to defend its territory from North Korean missile threats. This includes the deployment of Aegis-equipped destroyers and the development of the ground-based Patriot Advanced Capability (PAC)-3 system.

5. Cybersecurity: With the increasing use of technology in naval operations, Japan has established a cyber defense unit to protect its naval assets from cyber attacks. The navy has also conducted joint exercises with the U.S. to enhance its cybersecurity capabilities.
